intro: Costia persica, commonly known as Persian costia, is a flowering plant native to the regions of Persia and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically features slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Costia persica is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance and pleasant fragrance.
